intro: Metternichia affinis, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped white flowers. Its fruit is a spherical, yellowish berry that ripens in late summer. The species is notable for its ornamental value and its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
